title: How to Bake a Queen Elizabeth Cake

steps.headline: Spray an 8-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Add dates, boiling water and baking soda to a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Mix to combine and then let stand.

steps.headline: Add the butter and sugar to a mixing bowl.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt in another bowl.
Add the dry ingredients alternately with the date mixture to the butter mixture.
Fold in the chopped walnuts, if using.
Add the butter, brown sugar and cream to a saucepan.
steps.description: Bring to a boil stirring constantly.

steps.headline: Add the coconut and stir to combine.
Broil topping until golden and bubbly.
steps.description: Keep an eye on the cake so the topping does not burn.

text: Baking the Cake Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Spray an 8-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.  Add dates, boiling water and baking soda to a mixing bowl. Mix to combine and then let stand. Add the butter and sugar to a mixing bowl. Cream until light and fluffy. Stir in the vanilla.  Sift flour, baking powder and salt in another bowl.  Add the dry ingredients alternately with the date mixture to the butter mixture. Do this in two batches. Fold in the chopped walnuts, if using.  Bake cake 30 minutes.  Topping it Off Add the butter, brown sugar and cream to a saucepan. Bring to a boil stirring constantly. Add the coconut and stir to combine.  Spread topping over cake.  Broil topping until golden and bubbly. Keep an eye on the cake so the topping does not burn. Cut cake into squares.
